intro: Geunzia, commonly known as the golden star or starflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and includes several species that are often cultivated for their showy, star-shaped flowers. The plants typically have small, aromatic leaves and produce clusters of bright yellow or white blooms. Geunzia species are generally shrubs that thrive in well-drained soils and full sun. They are valued in gardens for their ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
